snippet: Craig Morton’s case reflects frustration with the proposed $765 million settlement in an earlier lawsuit, and it may prompt other players to pursue their own cases.
abstract: Former star quarterback Craig Morton sues the NFL, accusing league of deliberately hiding information about the dangerous effects of head hits and concussions; Morton's filing is born out of frustration with proposed class-action settlement and is a sign that some players may opt out of the settlement and continue pursuing their cases.
lead_paragraph: Craig Morton’s case reflects frustration with the proposed $765 million settlement in an earlier lawsuit, and it may prompt other players to pursue their own cases.

headline.main: Former Quarterback Sues League Over Hits to the Head
headline.print_headline: Former Quarterback Sues League Over Hits to the Head
